46b03c875ccb.name: Jonas Ellison
46b03c875ccb.bio: Motivational Messenger. Uplifter. Thought-Stimulator. Creative Living Guide. Life Coach. Exorcist. Girl-Dad. Author @HuffingtonPost | www.jonasellison.com

virtuals.subtitle: “What I want is what is.”
virtuals.emailSnippet:
Byron Katie said this. (Damn her. She always gets me thinking bettah, that woman.)

What if we could live this reality? What if this was your mantra?…

“Everything is perfect. As it is. Always”

What if ‘want’ or ‘lack’ never crossed our mind, despite the circumstances — whether we were living in a mansion or in a gutter? What if we could see the moment, feel the moment, and love the sh*t out of it regardless?

content.subtitle: I got a note from one of my favorite readers the other day. Here’s a snippet of what she said:

virtuals.snippet: I got a note from one of my favorite readers the other day. Here’s a snippet of what she said:
virtuals.subtitle: I got a note from one of my favorite readers the other day. Here’s a snippet of what she said:
virtuals.emailSnippet: Awhile back I realized that fear was guiding me. And, in a cruel twist of fate, I am afraid of fear. Then the best thing happened — just two days ago I realized that I am afraid of letting go of fear. It turns out this is something I can work with precisely because I know what you say is true, and if I remember it, the logical conclusion is that it is not only safe, but the best possible course of action, to let go of fear.

paragraphs.name: 97ea
paragraphs.text: I got a note from one of my favorite readers the other day. Here’s a snippet of what she said:

content.subtitle: There’s one common enemy that contaminates deeper feeling, turning it into negative emotion:

virtuals.snippet: There’s one common enemy that contaminates deeper feeling, turning it into negative emotion:
virtuals.subtitle: There’s one common enemy that contaminates deeper feeling, turning it into negative emotion:
virtuals.emailSnippet:
Insecurity (fear on wheels)…

Take any deep feeling — any positive emotion — add insecurity, and there you are, in the middle of the sh*t.

Here are a fistful of examples…

Exhilaration+Insecurity=Excitement

Exhilaration is a deeper feeling that fills us up and inspires us. It makes us thrilled about life. We’re enthused, but we’re calm and our energy level is high. Add insecurity and we become excited.

paragraphs.name: a874
paragraphs.text: There’s one common enemy that contaminates deeper feeling, turning it into negative emotion:

content.subtitle: A high-flame approach to the true meaning of compassion

virtuals.snippet: A high-flame approach to the true meaning of compassion
virtuals.subtitle: A high-flame approach to the true meaning of compassion
virtuals.emailSnippet:
I don’t care about your problems.

I don’t care about my problems.

I give zero sh*ts about how bad things are right now for you, for me, or for the world.

And the way I see it, this is the highest form of compassion there is.

If I’m in a trance where I’m feeling sorry for you or feeling horrible about a certain sect of people’s plight — I have nothing to offer.

Feeling sorry for anyone or anything for more than about 2 seconds is the opposite of compassion because I’m buying into the story…

paragraphs.name: 6e5f
paragraphs.text: A high-flame approach to the true meaning of compassion

content.subtitle: A brief synopsis about Creative Living

virtuals.snippet: A brief synopsis about Creative Living
virtuals.subtitle: A brief synopsis about Creative Living
virtuals.emailSnippet:
Your moment-to-moment experience comes from Source, not circumstance…

(Ever.)

Human experience is derived completely from thought. Thought flows from Source — from the infinite intelligence within — through the prism of our consciousness and onto the screen of our minds where it becomes ‘real’.

Not the other way around.

It’s a beautiful design. Only problem is when we don’t understand it.

See, we can think whatever we want.

paragraphs.text: A brief synopsis about Creative Living

virtuals.subtitle: “Michael Jackson was SET UP!”
virtuals.emailSnippet:
This is the message I was bombarded with as I walked into the office this morning.

Our office is on a little one way street in downtown Reno. We call it an alley. Even though it’s technically not an alley. Anyways…

We get a high number of — what’s the politically correct term here, transient folks — here in this alley. The tall apartment building that sits next door to our office provides ample nooks for them to set up shop and crash for the night away from the main streets of Reno.

content.subtitle: Positive thinking is a lot of damn work.

virtuals.snippet: Positive thinking is a lot of damn work.
virtuals.subtitle: Positive thinking is a lot of damn work.
virtuals.emailSnippet:
All those affirmations and voodoo tricks of the mind designed to ‘make us happy’.

Some people even completely revamp their living/working spaces so that every square foot is filled with a mantra or a talisman designed to get their thoughts back to positive.

(Question: What happens if they have to go to the store or something? Are they totally screwed then?)

It’s all good. Positive thinking is wonderful.

paragraphs.name: 19fa
paragraphs.text: Positive thinking is a lot of damn work.

cca88500a478.title: Finding the bus stop of epiphany 🚌

content.subtitle: Intellectual belief is something a lot of people seem to worship, in a way. They need the proof, the numbers, the stats, the case studies…

virtuals.snippet: Intellectual belief is something a lot of people seem to worship, in a way. They need the proof, the numbers, the stats, the case studies…
virtuals.subtitle: Intellectual belief is something a lot of people seem to worship, in a way. They need the proof, the numbers, the stats, the case studies…
virtuals.emailSnippet:
. For them to believe it — it must be field-tested and cited by experts.

My dad smoked multiple packs of cigarettes from age 20-ish until he was in his mid-50’s. Mind you, he was a ‘smart’ man. Very analytical. Shrewdly so, in fact.

He knew the numbers. He saw the TV programs about people dying of lung cancer and all kinds of other cancer. He saw his own relatives and friends become diagnosed with all kinds of horrible ailments from smoking.

paragraphs.name: 8d82
paragraphs.text: Finding the bus stop of epiphany 🚌

paragraphs.name: 736e
paragraphs.text: Intellectual belief is something a lot of people seem to worship, in a way. They need the proof…
